fields.headline: Countdown to the  Second Test
fields.bodyText: Match prediction Roy Hattersley, Former deputy leader of the Labour party England have a sporting chance - as long as morale hasn't broken down. They were well beneath their potential at Lord's. If I were picking the team, I would play the best wicketkeeper, rather than the best batsman-wicketkeeper. The batting can't be a complete failure again and we should go into the match with the belief that it is possible for us to win. Vital statistic In recent years Edgbaston has favoured the side batting second to a startling degree. Of the previous 13 Tests the team batting first has won one (England last year) and lost nine, including the last three Ashes contests, of which Australia won two (1993 and 2001) and England one (1997) . Great Edgbaston Test Fifth Ashes Test, 1985 The recalled Richard Ellison, who was advised not to play because of a heavy cold, bloodies Australia's nose with six first-innings wickets and 10 in the match. Tim Robinson and David Gower add 331 for the second wicket to put Australia on the floor with the England captain Gower recording his highest Test score, 215. Mike Gatting and Ian Botham (18 off seven balls) then apply the boot. With time running out, Allan Lamb's own boot controversially deflects Wayne Phillips' cut into Gower's hands. England go 2-1 up with one to play and go on to win the sixth Test at The Oval to win the Ashes 3-1. Edgbaston omen In 1955 Chelsea won the league, the ruling government stayed in power at the general election, a Royal wedding did not go ahead as planned ... and England recovered from a first-Test pummelling to win the Ashes 3-1. England - who featured such luminaries as Len Hutton, Colin Cowdrey and Denis Compton - lost the first Test of the tour in Brisbane by an innings and 154 runs but won the next three, wrapping the series up in Adelaide. Tip for Australia "What motivates men to slay the enemy is anger" - from Sun Tzu's Art of War John Buchanan's translation: Don't make Ashley Giles mad.
